message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The World Development Indicators dataset shows that the poverty rate has declined significantly across all regions of the world.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research paper analyzes data on the income and expenditure patterns of households in Ghana, obtained from the 2016 Living Standards Survey conducted by the Ghana Statistical Service.", "dataset": ["2016 Living Standards Survey"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on a combination of household survey data and satellite imagery to estimate the impact of drought on crop yields in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Global Financial Inclusion Database (Findex) to assess the level of financial inclusion among women in sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Database (Findex)"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) to examine the relationship between maternal education and child mortality in five African countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "This report utilizes data from both satellite imagery and weather stations to analyze the frequency and intensity of floods in Bangladesh, providing insights into their future occurrence.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "weather stations"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from multiple sources, including the International Energy Agency (IEA), renewable energy databases, and administrative data on subsidies, to provide a comprehensive analysis of the effects of subsidy reform on renewable electricity generation in Mexico.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "renewable energy databases", "administrative data on subsidies"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the impact of foreign aid on economic growth in low-income countries, using data from the AidData and World Development Indicators datasets.", "dataset": ["AidData", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from both the International Labour Organization (ILO) and Gallup World Poll surveys, we evaluate the potential impact of global disasters on livelihoods and employment opportunities in developing countries.", "dataset": ["International Labour Organization (ILO)", "Gallup World Poll surveys"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a comprehensive dataset on nutrient composition of commonly available foods in India to determine the extent of undernutrition among women and children in the country.", "dataset": ["comprehensive dataset on nutrient composition of commonly available foods in India"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "The World Development Indicators dataset shows that the poverty rate has declined significantly across all regions of the world.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research paper analyzes data on the income and expenditure patterns of households in Ghana, obtained from the 2016 Living Standards Survey conducted by the
